meanings.sent1: The decision to exclude him from the team was the unfairest thing I had ever seen.
meanings.sent2: It was unfairest that she had to do all the work while others took credit.
meanings.sent3: It seemed unfairest when the teacher gave extra points to only a few students.
meanings.sent4: The unfairest part of the game was when the referee made a biased call.
meanings.sent5: The unfairest treatment was when they punished him for something he didn't do.

meanings.sent1: The old, torn curtains were the unfairest decoration in the room.
meanings.sent2: She felt unfairest wearing the outdated dress to the party.
meanings.sent3: The unfairest painting in the gallery was the one with smudges and crooked lines.
meanings.sent4: The unfairest flower in the garden was the wilted one in the corner.
meanings.sent5: The unfairest room in the house was the one with peeling wallpaper and dusty furniture.
